Class Timer

java.lang.Object
sk.stuba.fiit.Timer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class Timer extends Object implements Cloneable, Serializable
Represents a simple timer that tracks elapsed time based on a defined period. The timer can be updated using the tick(float) method and will reset when the period is reached. It also implements Cloneable and Serializable.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Timer

      public Timer(float period)
      Constructs a new timer with a specified period. The current time is initialized to 0 and the timer is not elapsed.
      Parameters:
      period - the period for the timer

    • Timer

      public Timer(float period, float current)
      Constructs a new timer with a specified period and current time. The timer is not marked as elapsed upon creation.
      Parameters:
      period - the period for the timer
      current - the initial current time

  • Method Details

    • getCurrent

      public float getCurrent()
      Returns the current time elapsed since the last reset.
      Returns:
      the current elapsed time

    • setCurrent

      public void setCurrent(float current)
      Sets the current elapsed time.
      Parameters:
      current - the new current time

    • getPeriod

      public float getPeriod()
      Returns the period after which the timer resets and is considered elapsed.
      Returns:
      the timer period

    • setPeriod

      public void setPeriod(float period)
      Sets the timer period.
      Parameters:
      period - the new period

    • isElapsed

      public boolean isElapsed()
      Checks whether the timer has elapsed.
      Returns:
      true if the timer has elapsed, false otherwise

    • setElapsed

      public void setElapsed()
      Forces the timer to mark as elapsed, without affecting the current time.

    • tick

      public void tick(float deltaTime)
      Updates the timer by the specified time delta. If the accumulated time reaches or exceeds the period, the timer resets and is marked as elapsed.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - the time to add to the current timer

    • clone

      public Timer clone()
      Creates and returns a copy of this timer.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a cloned instance of the timer

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Compares this timer to the specified object for equality. Two timers are considered equal if their period, current, and elapsed values are equal.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - the object to compare with
      Returns:
      true if the timers are equal, false otherwise
